title: Calories in 2 Bacon Slices
meta_description: Discover calories in 2 bacon slices, including fat, protein, sodium, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks.
assumptions: Standard pork bacon, pan-fried until crisp, drained of excess fat; ~8 g per slice.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, thickness, cooking method, and curing; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two slices of cooked bacon provide ~86 kcal, mostly from fat, with ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal per cooked pork bacon slice.
Yes, two slices have ~384 mg sodium, mostly from curing.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in 2 bacon slices?
faqs.a: Approximately 6.6 g total fat, including 2.2 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Frying adds more fat if not drained; baking or microwaving can reduce by 5-10 kcal per slice.

faqs.q: How much protein in 2 slices of bacon?
faqs.a: Roughly 6 g protein, making it a decent savory snack.
